name: Medaglione Sock Pattern
description:
Medaglione, Italian form of Medallion.

Lace, twisted stitches and cables combine to create a beautiful and comfy sock.

Cuff down construction, though the sock can easily be worked toe up as well.

Difficulty Level: Intermediate

Yardage: Dependent of gauge and yarn selection.

Gauge: Pattern written for gauges of 7, 8, 9, 10 sts/in

Sizing Info: Pattern is written to accommodate foot circumferences of 6 in / 15 cm - 12 in / 30.5 cm (S, M, L, X-L) based on gauge.

Before purchase, please read and understand the following terms:

name: Krokus
description:
Krokus, alt. crocus

As February made its exit, I grew excited at the site of crocuses peeping through the snowy caps in our garden.

Knit in crocus-like colors, this stitch pattern resembles the budding crocus. This stitch pattern works quite well in both cuff down and toe up socks. (Instructions for cuff-down)

Difficulty Level: Intermediate

Yardage: Dependent of gauge and yarn selection.

Gauge: Pattern written for gauges of 6, 7 and 8 sts / in

Sizing Info: Pattern is written to accommodate foot circumferences of 6 in / 15 cm - 12 in / 30.5 cm based on gauge.

Before purchase, please read and understand the following terms:

name: Hachisu Mitts
description:
**Item listed is a knitting pattern, not the knitted item**

Hachisu, Japanese, lotus.

A texturally exciting mitts featuring cables, twisted stitches, bobbles and yarn overs.

- Difficulty Level: Intermediate

- 92 - 104 yards 38 gr / 1.35 oz Sport weight yarn.

- Gauge: 2” / 5 cm = 12 sts x 17.5 rows in St. st. It is best to knit a gauge swatch.

- Sizing Info: Pattern is written to accommodate 7 - 8.5” hand circumference. Easily adjustable.

name: Hachisu Tam
description:
**Item listed is a knitting pattern, not the knitted item**

Hachisu, Japanese, lotus.

A texturally exciting tam featuring cables, twisted stitches, bobbles and yarn overs, ending in a beautiful cabled lotus-like flower at the crown.

- Difficulty Level: Intermediate

- 163 - 189 yards 69 gr / 2.4 oz Sport weight yarn.

- Gauge: 2” / 5 cm = 12 sts x 17.5 rows in St. st. It is best to knit a gauge swatch.

- Sizing Info: Pattern is written to accommodate 20 - 22” head circumference. For smaller sizes, it is recommended to use fingering weight yarn. Larger sizes may consider DK or Worsted weight yarn.

name: Abalone Shawl Pattern
description:
**Item listed is a knitting pattern, not the knitted item**

Abalone, a shawl knitted side to side featuring a traditional Shetland Edging which resembles the shell of the Abalone, sits comfortably over the shoulders.

* Difficulty Level: Easy

* Abbreviated Charted Instructions

* 400 - 420 yds. (+120 gr) fingering or sport weight yarn. Shawl can be adjusted by adding to or omitting from sections. Please note yardage requirements may change.

* Gauge Info: 4” / 10 cm = 22 sts x 27 rows in St st. It is best to knit a gauge swatch to determine desired fabric only.

* Wingspan x Depth = 56” / 142.2 cm x 20” / 50.8 cm
